findings.title: Solidity compiler optimizations can be problematic
findings.description: Ajna protocol has enabled optional compiler optimizations in Solidity which may lead to security implications due to optimization bugs.

findings.title: findIndexAndSumOfSums ignores global scalar
findings.description: The `findIndexAndSumOfSums` method does not consider the global scalar of the scaled Fenwick tree while calculating the smallest index at which the prefix sum is at least the given target value, leading to incorrect indices and sums being returned if the global scalar contains a non-default value.

findings.title: Incorrect inflator arithmetic in view functions
findings.description: The `maxThresholdPrice` value returned by the `loansInfo` function is incorrectly multiplied by the value of `inflator` a second time, causing the value of `htp` to be overstated.

findings.title: Interest rates can become extreme, allowing denial-of-service attacks
findings.description: The protocol's interest rates could reach extreme highs or lows without a mechanism to return them to normal, allowing for potential denial-of-service attacks.

findings.title: Use of older versions of external libraries
findings.description: The Ajna protocol depends on several external libraries, most notably OpenZeppelin and PRBMath, but uses outdated versions.

findings.title: Extraordinary proposal can be used to steal extraordinary amounts of AJNA
findings.description: An attacker can create an extraordinary proposal to transfer all AJNA tokens to an account they control by gathering voting power and calling GrantFund.voteExtraordinary and GrantFund.executeExtraordinary.

findings.title: findMechanismOfProposal could shadow an extraordinary proposal
findings.description: The `findMechanismOfProposal` function will shadow an existing extraordinary proposal if a standard proposal with the same proposal ID exists.

findings.title: Missing checks of array lengths in LP allowance update functions
findings.description: The increaseLPAllowance() and decreaseLPAllowance() functions do not check if the input arrays 'amounts_' and 'indexes_' have equal lengths, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: findIndexAndSumOfSums ignores global scalar
findings.description: The findIndexAndSumOfSums function does not consider the global scalar of the Fenwick tree, which may lead to implicit security considerations.

findings.title: Denial of Service through Continual Interest Rate Increase
findings.description: The continual increase of interest rates caused by a highly collateralized loan can make a pool essentially unusable, causing a denial of service.
